refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A VteTerminal is a terminal emulator implemented as a GTK2 widget.

refsect2.title: VteTerminal
refsect2.para: All of these fields should be considered read-only.

listitem.simpara: Base GtkWidget of the terminal widget.
Scroll bar adjustments.
Width of a narrow character cell.
Height of a character cell.
The distance (in pixels) from the baseline of drawn text to the top of the character cell.
The distance (in pixels) from the baseline of drawn text to the bottom of the character cell.
Number of visible rows.
Number of visible columns.
The terminal's idea of what the window's title should be.
The terminal's idea of what the window's title should be when iconified.

refsect2.title: enum VteTerminalEraseBinding
refsect2.para: An enumerated type which can be used to indicate which string the terminal should send to an application when the user presses the Delete or Backspace keys.

listitem.simpara: For backspace, attempt to determine the right value from the terminal's IO settings. For delete, use the control sequence.
Send an ASCII backspace character (0x08).
Send an ASCII delete character (0x7F).
Send the "@7" control sequence.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new terminal widget.

listitem.simpara: a new VteTerminal object

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_im_append_menuitems ()
refsect2.para: Appends menu items for various input methods to the given menu. The user can select one of these items to modify the input method used by the terminal.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a GtkMenuShell

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_fork_command ()
refsect2.programlisting: pid_t vte_terminal_fork_command (VteTerminal *terminal, const char *command, char **argv, char **envv, const char *directory, gboolean lastlog, gboolean utmp, gboolean wtmp);
refsect2.para: Starts the specified command under a newly-allocated controlling pseudo-terminal. The argv and envv lists should be NULL-terminated, and argv[0] is expected to be the name of the file being run, as it would be if execve() were being called. TERM is automatically set to reflect the terminal widget's emulation setting. If lastlog, utmp, or wtmp are TRUE, logs the session to the specified system log files.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the name of a binary to run
the argument list to be passed to command
a list of environment variables to be added to the environment before starting command, or NULL
the name of a directory the command should start in, or NULL
TRUE if the session should be logged to the lastlog
TRUE if the session should be logged to the utmp/utmpx log
TRUE if the session should be logged to the wtmp/wtmpx log
the ID of the new process

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_forkpty ()
refsect2.programlisting: pid_t vte_terminal_forkpty (VteTerminal *terminal, char **envv, const char *directory, gboolean lastlog, gboolean utmp, gboolean wtmp);
refsect2.para: Starts a new child process under a newly-allocated controlling pseudo-terminal. TERM is automatically set to reflect the terminal widget's emulation setting. If lastlog, utmp, or wtmp are TRUE, logs the session to the specified system log files.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a list of environment variables to be added to the environment before starting returning in the child process, or NULL
the name of a directory the child process should change to, or NULL
TRUE if the session should be logged to the lastlog
TRUE if the session should be logged to the utmp/utmpx log
TRUE if the session should be logged to the wtmp/wtmpx log
the ID of the new process in the parent, 0 in the child, and -1 if there was an error

refsect2.para: Since 0.11.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_pty ()
refsect2.para: Attach an existing PTY master side to the terminal widget. Use instead of vte_terminal_fork_command() or vte_terminal_forkpty().

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a file descriptor of the master end of a PTY

refsect2.para: Since 0.12.1

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_feed ()
refsect2.para: Interprets data as if it were data received from a child process. This can either be used to drive the terminal without a child process, or just to mess with your users.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a string in the terminal's current encoding
the length of the string

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_feed_child ()
refsect2.para: Sends a block of UTF-8 text to the child as if it were entered by the user at the keyboard.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
data to send to the child
length of text in bytes, or -1 if text is NUL-terminated

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_feed_child_binary ()
refsect2.para: Sends a block of binary data to the child.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
data to send to the child
length of data

refsect2.para: Since 0.12.1

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_copy_clipboard ()
refsect2.para: Places the selected text in the terminal in the GDK_SELECTION_CLIPBOARD selection.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_paste_clipboard ()
refsect2.para: Sends the contents of the GDK_SELECTION_CLIPBOARD selection to the terminal's child. If necessary, the data is converted from UTF-8 to the terminal's current encoding. It's called on paste menu item, or when user presses Shift+Insert.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_copy_primary ()
refsect2.para: Places the selected text in the terminal in the GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY selection.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_paste_primary ()
refsect2.para: Sends the contents of the GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY selection to the terminal's child. If necessary, the data is converted from UTF-8 to the terminal's current encoding. The terminal will call also paste the GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY selection when the user clicks with the the second mouse button.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_size ()
refsect2.para: Attempts to change the terminal's size in terms of rows and columns. If the attempt succeeds, the widget will resize itself to the proper size.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the desired number of columns
the desired number of rows

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_audible_bell ()
refsect2.para: Controls whether or not the terminal will beep when the child outputs the "bl" sequence.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal should beep

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_audible_bell ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether or not the terminal will beep when the child outputs the "bl" sequence.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if audible bell is enabled, FALSE if not

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_visible_bell ()
refsect2.para: Controls whether or not the terminal will present a visible bell to the user when the child outputs the "bl" sequence. The terminal will clear itself to the default foreground color and then repaint itself.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal should flash

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_visible_bell ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether or not the terminal will present a visible bell to the user when the child outputs the "bl" sequence. The terminal will clear itself to the default foreground color and then repaint itself.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if visible bell is enabled, FALSE if not

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_allow_bold ()
refsect2.para: Controls whether or not the terminal will attempt to draw bold text by repainting text with a different offset.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal should attempt to draw bold text

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_allow_bold ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether or not the terminal will attempt to draw bold text by repainting text with a one-pixel offset.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if bolding is enabled, FALSE if not

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_scroll_on_output ()
refsect2.para: Controls whether or not the terminal will forcibly scroll to the bottom of the viewable history when the new data is received from the child.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal should scroll on output

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_scroll_on_keystroke ()
refsect2.para: Controls whether or not the terminal will forcibly scroll to the bottom of the viewable history when the user presses a key. Modifier keys do not trigger this behavior.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal should scroll on keystrokes

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_color_bold ()
refsect2.para: Sets the color used to draw bold text in the default foreground color.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new bold color

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_color_foreground ()
refsect2.para: Sets the foreground color used to draw normal text

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new foreground color

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_color_background ()
refsect2.para: Sets the background color for text which does not have a specific background color assigned. Only has effect when no background image is set and when the terminal is not transparent.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new background color

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_color_dim ()
refsect2.para: Sets the color used to draw dim text in the default foreground color.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new dim color

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_color_cursor ()
refsect2.para: Sets the background color for text which is under the cursor. If NULL, text under the cursor will be drawn with foreground and background colors reversed.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new color to use for the text cursor

refsect2.para: Since 0.11.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_color_highlight ()
refsect2.para: Sets the background color for text which is highlighted. If NULL, highlighted text (which is usually highlighted because it is selected) will be drawn with foreground and background colors reversed.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new color to use for highlighted text

refsect2.para: Since 0.11.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_colors ()
refsect2.programlisting: void vte_terminal_set_colors (VteTerminal *terminal, const GdkColor *foreground, const GdkColor *background, const GdkColor *palette, glong palette_size);
refsect2.para: The terminal widget uses a 28-color model comprised of the default foreground and background colors, the bold foreground color, the dim foreground color, an eight color palette, bold versions of the eight color palette, and a dim version of the the eight color palette.

palette_size must be either 0, 8, 16, or 24. If foreground is NULL and palette_size is greater than 0, the new foreground color is taken from palette[7]. If background is NULL and palette_size is greater than 0, the new background color is taken from palette[0]. If palette_size is 8 or 16, the third (dim) and possibly the second (bold) 8-color palettes are extrapolated from the new background color and the items in palette.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new foreground color, or NULL
the new background color, or NULL
the color palette
the number of entries in palette

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_default_colors ()
refsect2.para: Reset the terminal palette to reasonable compiled-in defaults.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_opacity ()
refsect2.para: Sets the opacity of the terminal background, were 0 means completely transparent and 65535 means completely opaque.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the new opacity

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_background_image ()
refsect2.para: Sets a background image for the widget. Text which would otherwise be drawn using the default background color will instead be drawn over the specified image. If necessary, the image will be tiled to cover the widget's entire visible area. If specified by vte_terminal_set_background_saturation(), the terminal will tint its in-memory copy of the image before applying it to the terminal.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a GdkPixbuf to use, or NULL to cancel

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_background_image_file ()
refsect2.para: Sets a background image for the widget. If specified by vte_terminal_set_background_saturation(), the terminal will tint its in-memory copy of the image before applying it to the terminal.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
path to an image file

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_background_saturation ()
refsect2.para: If a background image has been set using vte_terminal_set_background_image(), vte_terminal_set_background_image_file(), or vte_terminal_set_background_transparent(), and the saturation value is less than 1.0, the terminal will adjust the colors of the image before drawing the image. To do so, the terminal will create a copy of the background image (or snapshot of the root window) and modify its pixel values.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_background_transparent ()
refsect2.para: Sets the terminal's background image to the pixmap stored in the root window, adjusted so that if there are no windows below your application, the widget will appear to be transparent.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal should fake transparency

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_background_tint_color ()
refsect2.para: If a background image has been set using vte_terminal_set_background_image(), vte_terminal_set_background_image_file(), or vte_terminal_set_background_transparent(), and the value set by vte_terminal_set_background_saturation() is less than one, the terminal will adjust the color of the image before drawing the image. To do so, the terminal will create a copy of the background image (or snapshot of the root window) and modify its pixel values. The initial tint color is black.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a color which the terminal background should be tinted to if its saturation is not 1.0.

refsect2.para: Since 0.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_scroll_background ()
refsect2.para: Controls whether or not the terminal will scroll the background image (if one is set) when the text in the window must be scrolled.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal should scroll the background image along with text.

refsect2.para: Since 0.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_cursor_blinks ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether or not the cursor will blink. The length of the blinking cycle is controlled by the "gtk-cursor-blink-time" GTK+ setting.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the cursor should blink

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_scrollback_lines ()
refsect2.para: Sets the length of the scrollback buffer used by the terminal. The size of the scrollback buffer will be set to the larger of this value and the number of visible rows the widget can display, so 0 can safely be used to disable scrollback. Note that this setting only affects the normal screen buffer. For terminal types which have an alternate screen buffer, no scrollback is allowed on the alternate screen buffer.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the length of the history buffer

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_font ()
refsect2.para: Sets the font used for rendering all text displayed by the terminal, overriding any fonts set using gtk_widget_modify_font(). The terminal will immediately attempt to load the desired font, retrieve its metrics, and attempt to resize itself to keep the same number of rows and columns.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
The PangoFontDescription of the desired font.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_font_from_string ()
refsect2.para: A convenience function which converts name into a PangoFontDescription and passes it to vte_terminal_set_font().

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
A string describing the font.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_font_from_string_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: void vte_terminal_set_font_from_string_full (VteTerminal *terminal, const char *name, VteTerminalAntiAlias antialias);
refsect2.para: A convenience function which converts name into a PangoFontDescription and passes it to vte_terminal_set_font_full().

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
A string describing the font.
Whether or not to antialias the font (if possible).

refsect2.para: Since 0.11.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_font_full ()
refsect2.para: Sets the font used for rendering all text displayed by the terminal, overriding any fonts set using gtk_widget_modify_font(). The terminal will immediately attempt to load the desired font, retrieve its metrics, and attempt to resize itself to keep the same number of rows and columns.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
The PangoFontDescription of the desired font.
Specify if anti aliasing of the fonts is to be used or not.

refsect2.para: Since 0.11.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_font ()
refsect2.para: Queries the terminal for information about the fonts which will be used to draw text in the terminal.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a PangoFontDescription describing the font the terminal is currently using to render text.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_using_xft ()
refsect2.para: A VteTerminal can use multiple methods to draw text. This function allows an application to determine whether or not the current method uses fontconfig to find fonts. This setting cannot be changed by the caller, but in practice usually matches the behavior of GTK+ itself.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the terminal is using fontconfig to find fonts, FALSE if the terminal is using PangoX.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_has_selection ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the terminal currently contains selected text. Note that this is different from determining if the terminal is the owner of any GtkClipboard items.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if part of the text in the terminal is selected.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_word_chars ()
refsect2.para: When the user double-clicks to start selection, the terminal will extend the selection on word boundaries. It will treat characters included in spec as parts of words, and all other characters as word separators. Ranges of characters can be specified by separating them with a hyphen.
As a special case, if spec is NULL or the empty string, the terminal will treat all graphic non-punctuation non-space characters as word characters.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a specification

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_is_word_char ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a particular character is considered to be part of a word or not, based on the values last passed to vte_terminal_set_word_chars().

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a candidate Unicode code point
TRUE if the character is considered to be part of a word

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_backspace_binding ()
refsect2.para: Modifies the terminal's backspace key binding, which controls what string or control sequence the terminal sends to its child when the user presses the backspace key.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a VteTerminalEraseBinding for the backspace key

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_delete_binding ()
refsect2.para: Modifies the terminal's delete key binding, which controls what string or control sequence the terminal sends to its child when the user presses the delete key.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a VteTerminalEraseBinding for the delete key

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_mouse_autohide ()
refsect2.para: Changes the value of the terminal's mouse autohide setting. When autohiding is enabled, the mouse cursor will be hidden when the user presses a key and shown when the user moves the mouse. This setting can be read using vte_terminal_get_mouse_autohide().

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if the autohide should be enabled

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_mouse_autohide ()
refsect2.para: Determines the value of the terminal's mouse autohide setting. When autohiding is enabled, the mouse cursor will be hidden when the user presses a key and shown when the user moves the mouse. This setting can be changed using vte_terminal_set_mouse_autohide().

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE if autohiding is enabled, FALSE if not.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_reset ()
refsect2.para: Resets as much of the terminal's internal state as possible, discarding any unprocessed input data, resetting character attributes, cursor state, national character set state, status line, terminal modes (insert/delete), selection state, and encoding.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
TRUE to reset tabstops
TRUE to empty the terminal's scrollback buffer

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_text ()
refsect2.programlisting: char* vte_terminal_get_text (VteTerminal *terminal, gboolean (*is_selected) (VteTerminal *terminal,glong column,glong row,gpointer data), gpointer data, GArray *attributes);
refsect2.para: Extracts a view of the visible part of the terminal. If is_selected is not NULL, characters will only be read if is_selected returns TRUE after being passed the column and row, respectively. A VteCharAttributes structure is added to attributes for each byte added to the returned string detailing the character's position, colors, and other characteristics.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a callback
user data to be passed to the callback
location for storing text attributes
a text string which must be freed by the caller, or NULL.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_text_include_trailing_spaces ()
refsect2.programlisting: char* vte_terminal_get_text_include_trailing_spaces (VteTerminal *terminal, gboolean (*is_selected) (VteTerminal *terminal,glong column,glong row,gpointer data), gpointer data, GArray *attributes);
refsect2.para: Extracts a view of the visible part of the terminal. If is_selected is not NULL, characters will only be read if is_selected returns TRUE after being passed the column and row, respectively. A VteCharAttributes structure is added to attributes for each byte added to the returned string detailing the character's position, colors, and other characteristics. This function differs from vte_terminal_get_text in that trailing spaces at the end of lines are included.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a callback
user data to be passed to the callback
location for storing text attributes

a text string which must be freed by the caller, or NULL.
Since 0.11.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_text_range ()
refsect2.programlisting: char* vte_terminal_get_text_range (VteTerminal *terminal, glong start_row, glong start_col, glong end_row, glong end_col, gboolean (*is_selected) (VteTerminal *terminal,glong column,glong row,gpointer data), gpointer data, GArray *attributes);
refsect2.para: Extracts a view of the visible part of the terminal. If is_selected is not NULL, characters will only be read if is_selected returns TRUE after being passed the column and row, respectively. A VteCharAttributes structure is added to attributes for each byte added to the returned string detailing the character's position, colors, and other characteristics. The entire scrollback buffer is scanned, so it is possible to read the entire contents of the buffer using this function.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
first row to search for data
first column to search for data
last row to search for data
last column to search for data
a callback
user data to be passed to the callback
location for storing text attributes
a text string which must be freed by the caller, or NULL.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_cursor_position ()
refsect2.para: Reads the location of the insertion cursor and returns it. The row coordinate is absolute.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
long which will hold the column
long which will hold the row

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_match_clear_all ()
refsect2.para: Clears the list of regular expressions the terminal uses to highlight text when the user moves the mouse cursor.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_match_add ()
refsect2.para: Adds a regular expression to the list of matching expressions. When the user moves the mouse cursor over a section of displayed text which matches this expression, the text will be highlighted.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
a regular expression
an integer associated with this expression

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_match_remove ()
refsect2.para: Removes the regular expression which is associated with the given tag from the list of expressions which the terminal will highlight when the user moves the mouse cursor over matching text.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the tag of the regex to remove

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_match_check ()
refsect2.programlisting: char* vte_terminal_match_check (VteTerminal *terminal, glong column, glong row, int *tag);
refsect2.para: Checks if the text in and around the specified position matches any of the regular expressions previously set using vte_terminal_match_add(). If a match exists, the text string is returned and if tag is not NULL, the number associated with the matched regular expression will be stored in tag.
If more than one regular expression has been set with vte_terminal_match_add(), then expressions are checked in the order in which they were added.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the text column
the text row
pointer to an integer
a string which matches one of the previously set regular expressions, and which must be freed by the caller.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_match_set_cursor ()
refsect2.para: Sets which cursor the terminal will use if the pointer is over the pattern specified by tag. The terminal keeps a reference to cursor.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the tag of the regex which should use the specified cursor
the GdkCursor which the terminal should use when the pattern is highlighted

refsect2.para: Since 0.11

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_match_set_cursor_type ()
refsect2.programlisting: void vte_terminal_match_set_cursor_type (VteTerminal *terminal, int tag, GdkCursorType cursor_type);
refsect2.para: Sets which cursor the terminal will use if the pointer is over the pattern specified by tag. A convenience wrapper for vte_terminal_match_set_cursor().

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_emulation ()

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_set_encoding ()
refsect2.para: Changes the encoding the terminal will expect data from the child to be encoded with. For certain terminal types, applications executing in the terminal can change the encoding. The default encoding is defined by the application's locale settings.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_status_line ()
refsect2.para: Some terminal emulations specify a status line which is separate from the main display area, and define a means for applications to move the cursor to the status line and back.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
the current contents of the terminal's status line. For terminals like "xterm", this will usually be the empty string. The string must not be modified or freed by the caller.

refsect2.title: vte_terminal_get_padding ()
refsect2.para: Determines the amount of additional space the widget is using to pad the edges of its visible area. This is necessary for cases where characters in the selected font don't themselves include a padding area and the text itself would otherwise be contiguous with the window border. Applications which use the widget's row_count, column_count, char_height, and char_width fields to set geometry hints using gtk_window_set_geometry_hints() will need to add this value to the base size. The values returned in xpad and ypad are the total padding used in each direction, and do not need to be doubled.

listitem.simpara: a VteTerminal
address in which to store left/right-edge padding
address in which to store top/bottom-edge ypadding
